techmeme.title: South Korea arrests 215 people on suspicion of stealing $228M in crypto, the country's biggest crypto investment scam with 28 types of tokens sold to 15K people (Cynthia Kim/Reuters)
A group of 13 former TSMC staff sue the company in California over an alleged "discriminatory scheme" that favors Taiwanese foreign workers at its US plants (Sarah Emerson/Forbes)
Sources: execs at xAI rivals were alarmed by how fast Elon Musk set up the 100K GPU cluster Colossus; a source says Sam Altman argued with Microsoft over it (Anissa Gardizy/The Information)
Google says it will test removing news articles from EU-based publishers from Search for 1% of users in France, Poland, Greece, Belgium, and other EU countries (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Amazon launches Amazon Haul, a storefront on its app that promises "crazy low prices" on a range of items, to compete with Temu and Shein (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
